>From: Colin Green <cgreen@...>
> >>How about:
> >> error = abs(o-e) ^ 0.3

Early tests showed that it helped, but not enough...

So I added the code that would penalize for inadequate dynamic range in the 
outputs.  That helped.  Then I added the above formula to that penalization, 
so that the closer the dynamic range is to the expected, the less of a 
penalty it gets.  That seems to have made a big difference, because now 
topologies aren't 'optimizing' and then stagnating nearly as fast.  So while 
the overall progress appears to be slower, it also appears as though it 
might be more meaningful.

I'll know in a few days how much of a difference it really made. :)

If only I had my own beowulf cluster!!!  :)

-- John
